summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Christian Everdell regarding concerns about unauthorized DOJ visits to Maxwell at MDC and the status of a delayed discovery hard drive. The correspondence highlights defense efforts to protect Maxwell's rights and ensure access to discovery materials.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, who emails the U.S. Attorney's office to raise concerns about potential unauthorized DOJ visits and delayed discovery materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant who reported to her attorneys that representatives from DOJ might visit her, and who has not received a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Christian Everdell's email, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team at Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Christian Everdell's email, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team at Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Christian Everdell's email, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team at Cohen & Gresser LLP.

connections.description: Everdell is representing Maxwell in her criminal case, as evidenced by his communication with prosecutors about her rights and discovery access.
Cohen is listed on the defense team email, indicating he is part of the legal representation for Maxwell.
Menninger is listed on the defense team email, indicating she is part of the legal representation for Maxwell.
Pagliuca is listed on the defense team email, indicating he is part of the legal representation for Maxwell.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP working on Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Defense Inquiry About DOJ Visit
events.description: Maxwell's defense attorney Christian Everdell contacts the U.S. Attorney's office after Maxwell reports that representatives from DOJ will be meeting with her at MDC, requesting no DOJ representatives speak with her without counsel present.

events.title: Replacement Hard Drive Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office sends a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at her request.

events.title: Discovery Deadline
events.description: Deadline for completion of the initial tranche of discovery in Maxwell's case, which had passed with Maxwell still unable to review substantial portions due to missing hard drive.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY)
800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell reported to her attorneys that representatives from DOJ would be meeting with her at MDC on September 9, 2020, raising concerns about unauthorized contact.
Maxwell's defense team emphasized she is a represented party and requested that no DOJ representatives speak with her without her counsel present.
A replacement hard drive containing discovery materials was sent to Maxwell on September 3, 2020, but had not been received by September 9, 2020, hindering her ability to review discovery.
The initial discovery deadline of August 21, 2020, had passed with Maxwell still unable to access substantial portions of discovery due to the missing hard drive.
The email chain shows coordination between Maxwell's defense team (Cohen & Gresser LLP) and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding logistical and procedural matters in her case.
